astro/

sixtyv.pro


top source sixtyv

Astro

result = sixtyv(x)

Converts a vector of decimal numbers to sexigesimal (vector version of SIXTY in the astronomy library).

Return value

If X is a scalar, then Result is a 3-element vector of degrees, minutes and seconds. If X is an array of length N, then result is a 3xN array.

Parameters

x in

One or more decimal values, in degrees or hours.

Examples

IDL> print, sixtyv([90., -45.5]) 90.0000 0.00000 0.00000 -45.0000 30.0000 0.00000

Author information
